author: Corky Emrick
title: Bronson tested at home
text: By Corky Emrick Posted Sep. 30, 2015 at 11:13 PM A pair of local BCS volleyball powers met Wednesday night, with Bronson coming away with 3-0 win over Centreville. With nearly every point contested, the Lady Vikings won 25-23, 25-20, 25-16. “It was our Block Out Cancer game and our seniors last regular season home game so it was an emotional night, and we certainly didn’t come out to play to the best of our ability,” coach Jean LaClair said. “But I am proud of how the kids reacted and kept fighting to pull off the win.” Alexa Ratkowski had 30 assists, eight kills and digs aces, Jill Pyles had seven aces, nine kills and five digs, Allie Sikorski eight kills, 13 digs and two aces and Kirin Cekander added 12 digs and nine kills. Kiera Lasky had 17 digs and one ace, Adyson Lasky 11 digs and three aces, Kiana Mayer added two kills and Clare Mayes had four aces. Bronson battled to overcome an injury to a key back row player. “I thought we handled ourselves well,” LaClair said. “I have always preached that you have to be able to play without any one player, and we did that tonight, with other players stepping in to get the job done. “I thought Centreville played well tonight,” LaClair said. “They served tough and hit well.” One the night over $4,000 was raised for the fight against cancer. Centreville was led by Bailee May with seven kills, 11 digs, four blocks and one assist, Hannah Marchand had four kills, five digs, one assist and one block and Madison Hunter had eight assists, eight digs, four kills and one block. Skyler DeMeyer had nine assists, seven digs, four kills, one ace and one block, Carlee Odom had one ace, one kill and one dig, Sara Lewis and eight digs and Kalee Schrock added six digs, one assist, one ace and one block. “I’m very proud of my girls tonight. They had a game plan, they’ve prepared the last week and did well implementing,” Centreville coach Melissa Gales said. “It’s hard to see them come up short, but I know they played their hearts out. Bronson is number one in the state, always tough and there wasn’t one point I thought we might not win. “We got caught back on our heels a few times and Alexa (Ratkowski) took advantage of those moments,” Gales added. “It was a good night of volleyball.” White Pigeon wins White Pigeon swept New Buffalo in a BCS volleyball match Wednesday night. Riley Phelps led the Lady Chiefs with 11 kills and added seven digs, three aces and one assist, Madi Gremore had 11 digs and seven kills and Sydney Harmon added 10 kills, five digs, two blocks and three aces. Page 2 of 2 - Kathrina Hagner had seven kills, five digs, two blocks and one ace, Cheyenne Yoder had a team high 38 assists and added, four aces, one kill and two digs, Paige Brock had two aces, two kills, three digs and one block. Mendon 24, 25, 25, 25 Cass 26, 17, 20, 12 After dropping the first game to Cassopolis 26-24, Mendon took the next three 25-17, 25-20, 25-12 for a BCSwin Wednesday night. Megann Leighton led with 23 kills, four aces and one blocks, Kaley Smith had 29 digs and six aces, Cassie Plummer added 29 assists and two aces, Brandy DeLeeuw had 17 kills and one block and Amaijha Bailey had four aces.
